title: Char.gy secures £6.4m as CIIF makes third investment
lead: ​The third tranche of investment made by the Charging Infrastructure Investment Fund (CIIF) has been awarded to char.gy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK's largest domestic flexibility study CrowdFlex announced
lead: ​A consortium of energy companies, including National Grid ESO, SSEN, Octopus Energy and Ohme have announced the ‘largest domestic flexibility study’ ever held in the UK, dubbed CrowdFlex.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EV charging and heat pumps set to drive 2021 growth for electrical wholesalers
lead: ​The electric vehicle (EV) charging and heat pump product sectors are to grow following the electrical wholesale market contracting in 2020.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Climate Change Committee reports: energy sector praises ‘spot on’ recommendations
lead: Current± caught up with the energy sector to find out what they thought of the CCC’s two new progress reports.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Changing perceptions: the importance of V2G
lead: As an emerging technology, the business case for vehicle-to-grid chargepoints didn’t add up, however, after the world’s largest domestic trial, its role in the future of transport is more apparent, writes Greg Payne, senior technical specialist at Cenex.
author: Greg Payne

title: BSC data now presumed open to assist net zero progress
lead: All Balancing and Settlement Code (BSC) data is now presumed open, allowing individuals to request it be made openly available even if they are not a BSC Party.
author: Alice Grundy

title: P2P trading and demand management at industrial parks: A look at West Suffolk’s project
lead: Current± caught up with UrbanChain, GridDuck and West Suffolk Council to discuss their innovative P2P and demand management project, the benefits of targeting industrial customers and what’s next for the group.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: CCC calls for government to ‘be bold’ as it slams the gap between targets and policy
lead: ​The Climate Change Committee (CCC) has criticised the lack of firm policies to back up the UK’s ambitious climate change targets.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: P2P trial expands to offer simulated flexibility services following battery install
lead: ​A smart local flexible energy market trial dubbed the Urban Energy Club has started offering simulated flexibility services after the installation of a new battery.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO hails world first transition of gas power plant to provide inertia
lead: ​Two gas turbines at Triton Power’s Deeside Power Station have been repurposed to provide inertia and reactive power to National Grid ESO.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: How long can Dynamic Containment remain an economic hard hitter?
lead: In the most recent Current± Briefings webinar, we caught up with Habitat Energy's Mike Ryan to discuss when the tipping point of Dynamic Containment prices will be.
author: Current± Staff

title: BEIS backs down on requiring CMUs to be registered for the Balancing Mechanism
lead: ​Capacity Market Units (CMUs) will not be required to be part of the Balancing Mechanism yet, following consultation feedback.
author: Alice Grundy

title: E.ON begins installation of £4m heat pump system in London’s square mile
lead: ​Utility E.ON has started the installation of a hybrid heating system that combines a heat pump, recycled heat and its combined heating and power (CHP).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: National Grid ESO trial with UKPN finds reactive power could unlock 1.5GW of capacity in south east
lead: ​Savings of up to £100 million could be made with the introduction of a national reactive power market according to a trial conducted by National Grid ESO and UK Power Networks (UKPN).
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO: Sharing our progress towards zero carbon electricity ahead of COP26
lead: Ahead of COP26 in November Julian Leslie, head of Networks at National Grid ESO shares his thoughts on how electricity in Great Britain has decarbonised in recent times.
author: Julian Leslie

title: BP eyes IoT-enabled EV charging with US$7 million investment in IoTecha
lead: ​BP Ventures is to integrate internet of things (IoT) electric vehicle (EV) charging firm IoTecha’s products into its EV infrastructure following a US$7 million (£5 million) investment.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Net zero possible by 2050 for £14bn annually but ‘meaningful, urgent action’ needed
lead: ​The UK can achieve net zero by the middle of the century for just £14 billion more a year by leaning on domestic renewable energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Foresight embraces digitalisation of renewable assets with Sennen partnership
lead: ​Digitalisation of the Foresight Group’s full portfolio of sustainable infrastructure – including UK solar and wind assets – is well underway.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: Managing power shortages and new solar technologies
lead: The latest episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is now available to stream, as we take a look at how Texas and California are managing power shortages as the summer heat intensifies.
author: Current± Staff

title: How collaboration with energy firms can help overcome charging barriers for electric trucks
lead: ​Tevva is aiming to drive forward the electrification of trucks, with a new partnership recently signed with Vattenfall, but challenges surrounding charging infrastructure are still very much present.
author: Alice Grundy
